title: config.vm.box_download_checksum ignored since Vagrant 1.5.0
body:
Appear as if the config.vm.box_download_checksum Vagrantfile option has been ignored since Vagrant 1.5.0

Based on this Vagrantfile, with a fake checksum.

```
config.vm.box = "anlashok/wheezy64"
config.vm.box_url = "http://10.42.47.42/anlashok_wheezy64.box"
config.vm.box_download_checksum_type = "sha256"
config.vm.box_download_checksum = "0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef"
```

Using Vagrant 1.4.3 I get this expected failure.

```
andreas@corrino:~/workdir/anlatest$ vagrant --version
Vagrant 1.4.3
andreas@corrino:~/workdir/anlatest$ vagrant up 
Bringing machine 'default' up with 'virtualbox' provider...
[default] Box 'anlashok/wheezy64' was not found. Fetching box from specified URL for
the provider 'virtualbox'. Note that if the URL does not have
a box for this provider, you should interrupt Vagrant now and add
the box yourself. Otherwise Vagrant will attempt to download the
full box prior to discovering this error.
Downloading box from URL: http://10.42.47.42/anlashok_wheezy64.box
Calculating and comparing box checksum...ime remaining: --:--:--)
The checksum of the dowloaded box did not match the expected
value. Please verify that you have the proper URL setup and that
you're downloading the proper file.

Expected: 0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef
Received: 31ce372eb5c238f732603343c5c5da7b4beaa9aaadf3b695ddee224c3552d28e
andreas@corrino:~/workdir/anlatest$ 
```

While Vagrant 1.5.0 happily downloads and runs the imagine without caring about the checksum being wrong.

```
andreas@corrino:~/workdir/anlatest$ vagrant --version
Vagrant 1.5.0
andreas@corrino:~/workdir/anlatest$ vagrant up 
Bringing machine 'default' up with 'virtualbox' provider...
==> default: Box 'anlashok/wheezy64' could not be found. Attempting to find and install...
    default: Box Provider: virtualbox
    default: Box Version: >= 0
==> default: Adding box 'anlashok/wheezy64' (v0) for provider: virtualbox
    default: Downloading: http://10.42.47.42/anlashok_wheezy64.box
==> default: Successfully added box 'anlashok/wheezy64' (v0) for 'virtualbox'!
==> default: Importing base box 'anlashok/wheezy64'...
==> default: Matching MAC address for NAT networking...
==> default: Setting the name of the VM: anlatest_default_1413739882401_47235
==> default: Fixed port collision for 22 => 2222. Now on port 2202.
==> default: Clearing any previously set network interfaces...
==> default: Preparing network interfaces based on configuration...
    default: Adapter 1: nat
==> default: Forwarding ports...
    default: 22 => 2202 (adapter 1)
==> default: Booting VM...
==> default: Waiting for machine to boot. This may take a few minutes...
    default: SSH address: 127.0.0.1:2202
    default: SSH username: vagrant
    default: SSH auth method: private key
    default: Error: Connection timout. Retrying...
==> default: Machine booted and ready!
==> default: Checking for guest additions in VM...
==> default: Mounting shared folders...
    default: /vagrant => /home/andreas/workdir/anlatest
andreas@corrino:~/workdir/anlatest$
```

This being under Ubuntu 14.10, with the following ruby version

```
andreas@corrino:~/workdir/anlatest$ ruby --version
ruby 2.1.2p95 (2014-05-08) [x86_64-linux-gnu]
andreas@corrino:~/workdir/anlatest$
```

Also reported on the mailing list by another user: https://groups.google.com/d/msg/vagrant-up/Cv_CRxciH5M/q8K8YuLhZOkJ
